decks.notes: The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the board and opponent's actions through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, card draw, and enchantments. The deck aims to stall the game with cards like Settle the Wreckage and Cleansing Nova, while setting up win conditions with Nine Lives and March of Otherworldly Light. Memory Deluge and Omen of the Sea provide card advantage, while Dovin's Veto offers protection against opposing spells. The deck also includes utility lands and creatures like Coveted Falcon to provide additional support and flexibility in gameplay.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. It features powerful threats like Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodtithe Harvester, backed up by removal spells such as Fatal Push and Duress to control the board. The deck also includes a mix of lands to ensure smooth mana production and provides additional utility with cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Bitter Triumph. Overall, this deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using low-cost creatures known as "Weenies" in order to quickly build a strong board presence. By playing multiple creatures each turn, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and win the game before they can establish their own game plan. The inclusion of cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben helps boost the power of the weenies and disrupt the opponent's strategy, making it difficult for them to keep up with the aggressive tempo of the deck.

The focus of this deck is to use Greasefang, Okiba Boss in combination with other cards to create a powerful combo that can overwhelm the opponent quickly. The deck includes cards like Raffine's Informant and Parhelion II to support the main combo strategy, while also including removal spells like Fatal Push and hand disruption like Thoughtseize to control the game. The mana base is designed to provide the necessary colors for the deck to function smoothly. Ultimately, the goal is to set up the combo and win the game before the opponent can respond effectively.
